poem:
**The Wonder of Art**

In the echoing halls,  
anew: Cezanne speaks,  
brush in dance with Van Eyck,  
as jellyfish float—  
naive men paint  
their earnest truths.  
Rainbow rooms sing,  
where worlds collide  
in glimmers, free.  
Color whispers heavy,  
yet light;  
a tapestry woven  
in silence and awe.  
Art breathes—alive.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "A sumptuous rehang, jumbo jellyfish and naive manly paintings – the week in art Exhibition of the week The Wonder of ArtNew ways of seeing European art from Jan van Eyck to Cézanne and Picasso in a sumptuous rehang of one of the world’s richest and deepest art museums. And all for free. Read the five-star review. • National Gallery, London, from 10 May Also showing Chantal Joffe: The PrincePaintings of men and masculinity by". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
